intro: Knautia tatarica, commonly known as Tatarian knautia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fluffy clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry meadows and rocky soils, preferring full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and serrated along the edges. Knautia tatarica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
